O give thanks unto the LORD; for <FI>he is<Fi> good: because his mercy <FI>endureth<Fi> for ever.
Let Israel now say, that his mercy <FI>endureth<Fi> for ever.
Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy <FI>endureth<Fi> for ever.
Let them now that fear the LORD say, that his mercy <FI>endureth<Fi> for ever.
I called upon the LORD in distress: the LORD answered me, <FI>and set me<Fi> in a large place.<RF>in distress: Heb. out of distress<Rf>
The LORD <FI>is<Fi> on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?<RF>on…: Heb. for me<Rf>
The LORD taketh my part with them that help me: therefore shall I see <FI>my desire<Fi> upon them that hate me.
<FI>It is<Fi> better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in man.
<FI>It is<Fi> better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in princes.
All nations compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD will I destroy them.<RF>destroy…: Heb. cut them off<Rf>
They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.
They compassed me about like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.<RF>destroy: Heb. cut down<Rf>
Thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the LORD helped me.
The LORD <FI>is<Fi> my strength and song, and is become my salvation.
The voice of rejoicing and salvation <FI>is<Fi> in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.
The right hand of the LORD is exalted: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.
I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the LORD.
The LORD hath chastened me sore: but he hath not given me over unto death.<CM>
Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will go into them, <FI>and<Fi> I will praise the LORD:
This gate of the LORD, into which the righteous shall enter.
I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.
The stone <FI>which<Fi> the builders refused is become the head <FI>stone<Fi> of the corner.
This is the LORD'S doing; it <FI>is<Fi> marvellous in our eyes.<RF>the LORD's…: Heb. from the LORD<Rf>
This <FI>is<Fi> the day <FI>which<Fi> the LORD hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
Save now, I beseech thee, O LORD: O LORD, I beseech thee, send now prosperity.
Blessed <FI>be<Fi> he that cometh in the name of the LORD: we have blessed you out of the house of the LORD.
God <FI>is<Fi> the LORD, which hath shewed us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, <FI>even<Fi> unto the horns of the altar.
Thou <FI>art<Fi> my God, and I will praise thee: <FI>thou art<Fi> my God, I will exalt thee.
O give thanks unto the LORD; for <FI>he is<Fi> good: for his mercy <FI>endureth<Fi> for ever.<CM>
